comment.author: 14350023@N07
comment._content: From www.arthurbutler.org: On the 9th November 1931 he broke, and still holds, the record for piloting the smallest aircraft to fly from England to Australia. He completed the flight in nine days, one and three quarter hours in a Comper Swift.

comment.author: 26602074@N06
comment._content: Great shot, especially the woman posing for the camera. The location would be the Lithgow Racecourse, now Tony Luchetti Sportsground. His record setting airplane, G-ABRE appears to be no longer extant. "Arthur Butler, a contemporary and friend of Charles Kingsford-Smith and Nancy Bird-Walton, was a remarkable man.Although still well remembered in aviation circles, his is not a household name in this country. Butler demonstrated ultra competence in every field of his endeavour, accomplished pilot, navigator, engineer, cartographer and entrepreneurial airline manager. " Links : en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Comper_Swift www.gilgandra.nsw.gov.au/community/tourism/attractions/ar... www.gilgandra.nsw.gov.au/files/AB_3_fold_Final_Feb_081.pdf
